Text Anaysis.title: Text Anaysis
Text Anaysis.description: Questions to examine textual analysis regarding income policy

Q02002.title: Main considerations
Q02002.description: When you think about federal personal income taxation and whether the U.S. should have higher or lower federal personal income taxes, what are the main considerations that come to your mind?

Q02003.title: Goals
Q02003.description: What would be a “good” federal tax system in your view? What would be the goal of a good tax system?

Q02004.title: Shortcomings
Q02004.description: What do you think are the issues with or shortcomings of the U.S. federal income tax system?

Personal Exposure.title: Personal Exposure
Personal Exposure.description: Questions on the personal exposure the respondent believes they have to income tax policy

Q03001_en.title: Income Tax Policy Effect
Q03001_en.description: Do you feel that U.S. federal income tax policy has important direct effects on your own life?
sorter: No, It has no direct effects on my own life
It has some effects on my own life
Yes, it has very important direct effects on my own life

Policy Knowledge.title: Policy Knowledge
Policy Knowledge.description: Questions to examine the individual's knowledge of income tax policy

Q04004_en.title: Perceived Equality of Income Tax Share
Q04004_en.description: How equally the respondent thinks the share of income tax is distributed across people in the U.S.
sorter: Everyone pays more or less the same share
People pay somewhat different shares of their income in taxes
People pay very different shares of their incomes in taxes

Q04005_en.title: Taxed Share by Income
Q04005_en.description: Whether respondent thinks people with higher incomes pay a higher or lower share of their total income in federal taxes than people with lower incomes?
sorter: People with higher incomes pay a higher share of their income in taxes than those with lower incomes.
People with higher incomes pay a lower share of their income in taxes than those with lower incomes.
Q04005_en.correct: People pay very different shares of their income in taxes

Q04007_en.title: Top Tax Rate Threshold
Q04007_en.description: How high is the threshold of total annual income for a married household above which the top tax rate applies?

Q04008_en.title: Proportion in Top Tax Rate
Q04008_en.description: Out of 100 households in the U.S., how many are in the top federal personal income tax bracket?

Q04009_en.title: Top Tax Rate Today
Q04009_en.description: What is the top federal personal income tax rate in the U.S.?

Q04010_en.title: Top Tax Share of Income
Q04010_en.description: What share of their total income do people in the top federal personal income tax bracket pay in taxes?

Q04011_en.title: 1950s Top Tax Rate
Q04011_en.description: Can you guess what the top federal personal income tax rate used to be in the 1950s in the U.S.?

Q04012_en.title: No Federal Income Tax
Q04012_en.description: Out of 100 U.S. households, how many pay no federal income taxes?

Q04013_en.title: Median Tax Share of Income
Q04013_en.description: What share of income do you think a middle-class household pays in federal income taxes?

Q04014_en.title: U.S. Relative Taxation
Q04014_en.description: How respondent thinks U.S. federal income taxes compare to those of other rich countries such as Canada or Western Europe

Q04016_en.title: Top 1% Share of Income
Q04016_en.description: What share of total national income do you think goes to the top 1% richest households?

Q04019_en.title: Reason for Wealth
Q04019_en.description: Which has more to do with why a person is rich?
sorter: Because she or he worked harder than others
Because she or he had more advantages than others

Q04020_en.title: Change in Top 1% Share of Income
Q04020_en.description: How has the share of total U.S. income that goes to the top 1% in the U.S. evolved over the past 30 years?
sorter: It has increased by a lot
It has decreased by a lot
Q04020_en.correct: It has increased by a lot

Outcomes.title: Outcomes
Outcomes.description: Questions to test the individual's perception of income tax policy outcomes

Q07001_en.title: Tax System Fairness (Broad)
Q07001_en.description: How fair the respondent thinks the current U.S. federal income tax system is

Q07002_en.title: Tax System Satisfaction
Q07002_en.description: How satisfied the respondent is with the current U.S. federal income tax system

Q07003_en.title: Tax Share Fairness (Specific)
Q07003_en.description: How fair the respondent thinks the tax system is regarding high income housheolds, depending on their treatment
sorter: Pay much more than their fair share in income taxes
Pay more than their fair share in income taxes
Pay their fair share in income taxes
Pay less than their fair share in income taxes
Pay much less than their fair share in income taxes

questions.description: Would you say that high income, upper-class households in the U.S. today...

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Would you say that you...

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Would you say that high income, upper-class women in the U.S. today...

Q07004_en.title: Middle Class Tax Share Fairness
Q07004_en.description: How fair the respondent thinks the tax system is regarding middle-class housheolds, depending on their treatment
sorter: Pay much more than their fair share in income taxes
Pay more than their fair share in income taxes
Pay their fair share in income taxes
Pay less than their fair share in income taxes
Pay much less than their fair share in income taxes

questions.title: Control
questions.description: Would you say that middle-class households in the U.S. today...

questions.title: Gender
questions.description: Would you say that women in the middle-class in the U.S. today...

Q07005_en.title: Money/Wealth Distribution Fairness
Q07005_en.description: How fair the respondent believes the distribution of money and wealth is in the U.S.
sorter: The distribution and money and wealth in this country today is fair
The money and wealth in this country should be more evenly distributed among a larger percentage of the people

Q07006_en.title: Income Inequality Issue
Q07006_en.description: How big of an issue do you think income inequality is in America?

Q07008_en.title: Support Top Income Tax Increase for Lower-Income People
Q07008_en.description: Support for increasing the top income tax rate if the additional revenue raised supports lower-income individuals

questions.title: Control
questions.description: The additional revenue raised is used to expand programs that support lower-income individuals

questions.title: Gender
questions.description: The additional revenue raised is used to expand programs that support lower-income women

Q07009_en.title: Support Top Income Tax Increase for Investment
Q07009_en.description: Support for increasing the top income tax rate if the additional revenue raised supports investment

Tax Change Behavior.title: Tax Change Behavior
Tax Change Behavior.description: How would increasing the federal income tax rate for the richest individuals encourage the following behavior(s)?

Q06001_1_en.title: Behavioral Effects of Taxes for the Rich
Q06001_1_en.description: If federal income taxes for the richest people in the economy increase, how likely are people to...

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal personal income tax rate were to increase for the richest people in the economy, to what extent would it encourage them to evade taxes

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If your federal personal income tax rate were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to evade taxes

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal personal income tax rate were to increase for a given woman among the richest people in the economy, to what extent would it encourage this woman to evade taxes

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal personal income tax rate were to increase for the richest people in the economy, to what extent would it encourage them to work less

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If your federal personal income tax rate were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to work less

questions.title: GENDER

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal personal income tax rate were to increase for the richest people in the economy, to what extent would it encourage them to stop working altogether

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If your federal personal income tax rate were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to stop working altogether

questions.title: GENDER

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If your federal personal income tax rate were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to have your spouse stop working

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal personal income tax rate were to increase for a given woman among the richest people in the economy, to what extent would it encourage this woman to have her spouse stop working

CONTROL

Q06006_en.title: Effect on Economic Activity
Q06006_en.description: How the respondent thinks increasing the top federal income tax rate would affect economic activity
sorter: Hurt economic activity in the U.S.
Not have an effect on economic activity in the U.S.
Help economic activity in the U.S.

questions.title: Control
questions.description: Do you think that increasing income taxes on high- income households would hurt economic activity, not have an effect on economic activity, or help economic activity in the U.S.?

questions.title: Gender
questions.description: Do you think that increasing income taxes that high- income women have to pay would hurt economic activity, not have an effect on economic activity, or help economic activity in the U.S.?

Q06007_en.title: Effect of High-Income Tax Cut on Federal Deficit
Q06007_en.description: How the respondent views the long-term impact of tax cuts on high-income households on the federal budget deficit?
sorter: The tax cuts would increase the deficit in the long run because the government would take in a lot less money that it won’t be able to recover
The tax cuts would decrease the deficit in the long run because they would stimulate the economy and bring in more money for the government

questions.title: Control
questions.description: Which comes closer to your view about the long-term impact that tax cuts on high-income households may have on the federal budget deficit?

questions.title: You
questions.description: Which comes closer to your view about the long-term impact that tax cuts on households with your level of income may have on the federal budget deficit?

questions.title: Gender
questions.description: Which comes closer to your view about the long-term impact that the cuts on taxes that high-income women have to pay may have on the federal budget deficit?

Q06008_en.title: Effect of Middle-Class Tax Cut on Federal Deficit
Q06008_en.description: How the respondent views the long-term impact of tax cuts on middle-class households on the federal budget deficit?
sorter: The tax cuts would increase the deficit in the long run because the government would take in a lot less money that it won’t be able to recover
The tax cuts would decrease the deficit in the long run because they would stimulate the economy and bring in more money for the government

questions.title: Control
questions.description: What about the long-term impact that tax cuts on the middle-class may have on the federal budget deficit?

questions.title: Gender
questions.description: What about the long-term impact that cuts on taxes that women from the middle-class have to pay may have on the federal budget deficit?

questions.title: Control
questions.description: Do you think that a progressive federal income tax system is an important tool to reduce inequality?

questions.title: Gender
questions.description: Do you think that a progressive federal income tax system is an important tool to reduce inequality?

Text Anaysis.title: Text Anaysis
Text Anaysis.description: Questions to examine textual analysis regarding estate tax policy

Q02002.title: Main considerations
Q02002.description: When you think about the federal estate tax and whether the U.S. should have a higher or a lower federal estate tax, what are the main considerations that come to your mind?

Q02003.title: Goals
Q02003.description: n your view, what would be a “good” federal estate tax that you would be satisfied with? What would be the goal of a good estate tax system?

Q02004.title: Shortcomings
Q02004.description: What do you think are the shortcomings of the U.S. federal estate tax?

Personal Exposure.title: Personal Exposure
Personal Exposure.description: Questions to examine the individual's exposure to estate tax policy

Q03001_en.title: Personal Effects of Federal Estate Tax
Q03001_en.description: Do you feel personally affected by the federal estate tax?

Q03004_en.title: Likelihood Your Estate is Taxed
Q03004_en.description: How likely is it that your estate will be subject to the federal estate tax in the future?

Knowledge about policy.title: Knowledge about policy
Knowledge about policy.description: Questions to examine the individual's knowledge about estate tax policy

Q04002_en.title: Scope of Estate Tax
Q04002_en.correct: No, it is levied only on the portion of an estate’s value that exceeds a specified exemption level

Q04003_en.title: Number of Estates Subject to Tax at Death
Q04003_en.description: Number of estates subject to tax at death
Q04003_en.source: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities

Q04005_en.title: Estate Tax Exemption Threshold
Q04005_en.description: Please specify the exact estate tax exemption threshold.

Q04006_en.title: Estate Tax Rate Above Threshold
Q04006_en.description: At what rate is each dollar of estate that is passed on and falls above the exemption threshold taxed?

Q04007_en.title: Estate Tax Rate in 1950s
Q04007_en.description: At what rate was each dollar of estate that is passed on and falls above the threshold taxed in the 1950s?

Q04008_en.title: Small Businesses
Q04008_en.description: Do you think many small business or small farm owners are subject to the federal estate tax?
sorter: Almost all are subject to the estate tax; Many are subject to the estate tax
Few are subject to the estate tax
Almost none are subject to the estate tax
Q04008_en.correct: Few, only roughly 80 small bussiness and small farm estates nationwidel will face any estate tax in 2017
Q04008_en.source: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities

Q04009_en.title: Double Taxation
Q04009_en.description: Does federal estate tax policy mostly tax assets that have already been taxed, thus leading to ”double taxation”?
sorter: It mostly taxes assets that have not been taxed before
Q04009_en.correct: It is mostly taxing assets that have not been taxed before during the life of the owner. Under the current tax system, capital gains tax is due on the appreciation of assets, such as real estate, stock, or an art collection, only when the owner “realizes” the gain (usually by selling the asset). Therefore, the increase in the value of an asset is never subject to income tax if the owner holds on to the asset until death.
Q04009_en.source: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities

Q04010_en.title: Share of Estates that are Unrealized Capital Gains
Q04010_en.description: What share of estates subject to the federal estate tax is made up of unrealized capital gains that have never been taxed before?
Q04010_en.source: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities

Q04011_en.title: Average Rate on Taxed Estates
Q04011_en.description: What fraction of the total value of estates subject to the federal estate tax is paid in taxes?
Q04011_en.source: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities

Q04012_en.title: Cost Basis at Death
Q04012_en.description: Do you know what the stepped-up cost basis at death is?
Q04012_en.correct: It is the asset's (receive from the benefactor) market value at the time the benefactor dies

Q04014_en.title: Example
Q04014_en.description: Let’s work through a concrete example about the federal estate tax now. Jack inherits a house from his father. His father paid $50,000 for the house 30 years ago. This house is now worth $350,000 at the time of the father’s death. But Jack manages to sell the house for $400,000.

questions.title: Jack's Capital Gains
questions.description: What amount will the IRS consider as capital gains that Jack made and that will be taxed at the capital gains tax rate?

questions.title: Jack's Father's Capital Gains
questions.description: What amount will the IRS consider as capital gains that Jack's father made and that will be taxed at the capital gains tax rate?

It has decreased by a lot

Q04018_en.description: What share of total wealth owned by households in the U.S. today is inherited from their parents?

sorter: Because she or he worked harder than others

Expected Effects.title: Expected Effects
Expected Effects.description: Questions to examine expected effects of estate tax policy

Q06001_1_en.title: Increasing Federal Estate Taxes - Wealthy
Q06001_1_en.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage very wealthy individuals towards the following behaviors?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to evade taxes?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to evade taxes?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to evade taxes?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to work less?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to work less?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to work less?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to stop working?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to stop working?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to stop working?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to have spouse stop working?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to have spouse stop working?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to have spouse stop working?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to move state?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to move state?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to move state?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to be less entrepreneurial?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to be less entrepreneurial?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to be less entrepreneurial?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax increases, to what extent would it encourage the very wealthy individuals to save less?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to save less?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase for women among the richest in the economy, to what extent would it encourage these women to save less?

Q06002_1_en.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage young people who are not yet rich towards the following behaviors?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these people to evade taxes?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to evade taxes?

questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these women to save less?

questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these people to work less?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to evade taxes?

questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these women to save less?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these people to work less?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to evade taxes?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these women to save less?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these people to work less?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage you to evade taxes?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these women to save less?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If the federal estate tax were to increase, to what extent would it encourage these people to work less?

questions.title: YOU

questions.title: GENDER

Q06004_en.title: Economic Activity
Q06004_en.description: What effect would increasing the federal estate tax on wealthy households would have on economic activity?
sorter: Have no effect on economic activity

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: What effect do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on wealthy households would have on economic activity?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: What effect do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of households similar to yours would have on economic activity?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: What effect do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of wealthy women would have on economic activity?

Q06005_en.title: Federal Budget Deficit
Q06005_en.description: View about the long-term impact that cuts in the federal estate tax for wealthy households may have on the federal budget deficit
sorter: The tax cuts would increase the deficit in the long run because the government would take in a lot less money that it won’t be able to recover
The tax cuts would decrease the deficit in the long run because they would stimulate the economy and bring in more money for the government

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Which comes closer to your view about the long-term impact that cuts in the federal estate tax for wealthy households may have on the federal budget deficit:

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Which comes closer to your view about the long-term impact that cuts in the federal estate tax on the estates of households similar to yours may have on the federal budget deficit:

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Which comes closer to your view about the long-term im- pact that cuts in the federal estate tax on the estates of wealthy women may have to pay may have on the federal budget deficit:

Q06006_en.title: Federal Budget Deficit
Q06006_en.description: View on whether increasing the federal estate tax is a good way to reduce wealth inequality?
sorter: It is one of the best ways to reduce wealth inequality
It is a good way to reduce wealth inequality, but there are better ways
It is a bad way to reduce wealth inequality
It is one of the worst ways to reduce wealth inequality

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you think that increasing the federal estate tax is a good or bad way to reduce wealth inequality?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of households similar to yours is a good or bad way to reduce wealth inequality?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Do you think that increasing the federal estate tax on the estates of wealthy women is a good or bad way to reduce wealth inequality?

Q06008_en.title: Wealthy Paying Estate Tax at Death
Q06008_en.description: Is it fair that the estate of wealthy parents who have worked hard and saved a lot is subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair that the estate of wealthy parents who have worked hard and saved a lot in order to pass on wealth to their children is subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair that the estate for which you have worked hard and saved a lot in order to pass on wealth to your children will be subject to the federal estate tax at your death?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair that the estate of a wealthy woman who has worked hard and saved a lot in order to pass on wealth to her children is subject to the federal estate tax at death?

Q06009_en.title: Inherited Weatlh Estate Tax at Death
Q06009_en.description: Imagine wealthy parents who inherited weatlh from their own parents. Is it fair that their estate be subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair for their estate to be subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair for their estate to be subject to the federal estate tax at death?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair for her estate to be subject to the federal estate tax at death?

Q06010_en.title: Wealthy Family Resource Advantage
Q06010_en.description: Is it fair that children born in very wealthy families have access to better resources than children from less wealthy families?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you think it is fair or unfair that children born in very wealthy families have access to better schools, better medical care, better neighborhoods, and better professional and social networks than children from less wealthy families?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Do you think that it is fair or unfair that people born in wealthier families than yours have had access to better schools, better medical care, better neighbor- hoods, and better professional and social networks than you have had?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Do you think that it is fair or unfair that a girl born to a very wealthy mother has access to better schools, better medical care, better neighborhoods, and better professional and social networks than a girl born to a less wealthy mother?

Q06011_en.title: Wealthy Family Inheritance
Q06011_en.description: Is it fair that children born in very wealthy families inherit much more than children born in less wealthy families?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you think it is fair or unfair that children born in very wealthy families inherit much more than children born in less wealthy families?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Do you think it is fair or unfair that people born in wealthier families than yours inherit more than you?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Do you think that it is fair or unfair that a girl born to a very wealthy mother inherits much more than a girl born to a less wealthy mother?

Results.title: Results
Results.description: Questions to examine results of estate tax policy

Q07001_en.title: Wealth/Money Distribution
Q07001_en.description: Is the distribution of money and wealth in this country today fair?
sorter: The distribution of money and wealth in this country today is fair
The money and wealth in this country should be more evenly distributed among a larger percentage of the people

Q07002_en.title: Wealth Inequality
Q07002_en.description: How big of a problem do you think wealth inequality is in America?

Q07003_en.title: Fairness of System
Q07003_en.description: How fair would you say that the current U.S. federal estate tax system is?

Q07004_en.title: Satisfaction with System
Q07004_en.description: How satisfied are you with the current U.S. federal estate tax system?

Q07005_en.title: Existence of System
Q07005_en.description: Do you think there should be a federal estate tax in the U.S.?

Q07006_en.title: Changes in Estate Tax
Q07006_en.description: Do you think the federal estate tax should be increased, left at the current level, or lowered?

Government Questions (Specific).title: Government Questions (Specific)
Government Questions (Specific).description: Questions to examine government intervention regarding estate tax policy

Q09001_en.title: Reduce Inequalities
Q09001_en.description: To reduce differences in wealth between rich and poor people, the government (local, state, or federal) has the ability and the tools to do:

Q09002_en.title: Improve Opportunities
Q09002_en.description: To improve opportunities for children from low-income families, the government (local, state, or federal) has the ability and the tools to do:

Text Anaysis.title: Text Anaysis
Text Anaysis.description: Questions to examine textual analysis regarding health policy

Q02002.title: Main considerations
Q02002.description: When you think about health insurance and whether the U.S. should have universal health insurance for all, what are the main considerations — in favor or against it — that come to you mind?

Q02003.title: Goals
Q02003.description: What would be a “good” health insurance system in your view? What would be the goal of a good health insurance system?

Q02004.title: Shortcomings
Q02004.description: What do you personally see as the biggest problem with health insurance in the United States today?

Personal Exposure.title: Personal Exposure
Personal Exposure.description: Questions to examine the individual's exposure to health policy

Q03001_en.title: Have Health Insurance
Q03001_en.description: Do you currently have health insurance?

Q03003_en.title: Medicaid or Medicare
Q03003_en.description: Are you on Medicaid or Medicare

Q03004_en.title: Who Pays for Insurance
Q03004_en.description: Who pays for the cost of premiums on your health insurance?

Q03005_en.title: Medical Treatment Delays
Q03005_en.description: Within the last 12 months, have you or a member of your family put off medical treatment because of the cost?

Q03006_w.title: Seriousness of Condition
Q03006_w.description: If you put off medical treatment because of cost, how serious was the condition or illness?

Q03007_en.title: Satisfaction with Healthcare Cost
Q03007_en.description: Satisfaction with the total cost you pay for your healthcare?

Q03008_en.title: Quality of Healthcare
Q03008_en.description: Quality of the health care you receive?

Knowledge about policy.title: Knowledge about policy
Knowledge about policy.description: Questions to examine the individual's knowledge about health policy

dummy_medicaid.title: Medicaid
dummy_medicaid.description: What is Medicaid? Who is eligible for Medicaid?
dummy_medicaid.correct: Medicaid provides health coverage to millions of Americans, including eligible low-income adults, children, pregnant women, elderly adults and people with disabilities. Medicaid is administered by states, according to federal requirements. The program is funded jointly by states and the federal government.

dummy_medicare.title: Medicare
dummy_medicare.description: What is Medicare? Who is eligible for Medicare?
dummy_medicare.correct: Medicare is the federal health insurance program for: People who are 65 or older; Certain younger people with disabilities; People with End-Stage Renal Disease (permanent kidney failure requiring dialysis or a transplant, sometimes called ESRD)

Q04020_1_en.title: Health Insurance Coverage Programs
Q04020_1_en.description: Out of 100 Americans, how many get their health insurance coverage through the following programs?

questions.title: Share of Americans on Medicaid
questions.description: Medicaid

questions.title: Share of Americans on Medicare
questions.description: Medicare

questions.title: Share of Americans on Employer-based Insurance
questions.description: Group health insurance through employer

questions.title: Share of Americans on Other Insurance
questions.description: Other insurance (policies purchased directly from an insurance company, military, etc.)

questions.title: Share of Americans Uninsured
questions.description: Uninsured

Q04007_en.title: Share of American Children on Medicaid
Q04007_en.description: Out of 100 American children, aged below 18, how many are enrolled in Medicaid?

Q04010_1_en.title: Health Insurance Premium Criteria
Q04010_1_en.description: Are insurance companies currently allowed to set different premiums based on the following characteristics?

questions.title: Based on gender
questions.description: Gender

questions.title: Based on age
questions.description: Age

questions.title: Based on tobacco
questions.description: Tobacco use

questions.title: Based on location
questions.description: Where the person lives

questions.title: Based on pre-existing conditions
questions.description: Preexisting conditions (such as having diabetes, obesity, or being pregnant at the time of purchase of the insurance)

Q04011_en.title: Individual Mandate in 2018
Q04011_en.description: In 2018, was there an individual mandate, whereby everyone was obligated to buy health insurance?

Q04012_en.title: No Insurance Before 2018
Q04012_en.description: What happened if you did not have health insurance, until 2018?
sorter: A penalty had to be paid
You were forced to buy insurance
Q04012_en.correct: A penalty had to be paid

Q04013_en.title: Changes to Individual Mandate in 2019
Q04013_en.description: Were any changes made to the individual mandate in 2019?

Q04014_en.title: Legislation Changes to Individual Mandate in 2019
Q04014_en.description: How did the legislation on the individual mandate change in 2019?
sorter: The penalty was reduced to zero
Q04014_en.correct: The penalty was reduced to zero

Q04015_en.title: Employer Mandate
Q04015_en.description: Is there currently an employer mandate, whereby employers have to provide healt insurance to their employees?
sorter: Yes, all employers are required to provide health insurance to their employees
Yes, but small employers are excluded from this requirement
No, employers are not required to provide health insurance to their employees
Q04015_en.correct: Yes, but small employers are excluded from this requirement

Q04016_c_en.title: Federal Poverty Level - Medicaid eligibility
Q04016_c_en.description: How high is that FPL threshold percentage for a family like yours to be eligible for Medicaid?

Q04017_en.title: Impact of ACA on FPL-based Eligibility
Q04017_en.description: How did the FPL threshold percentage change, if at all, as a result of the Affordable Care Act

Q04018_en.title: U.S. Relative Healthcare Spending
Q04018_en.description: Relative to other rich countries like France, Germany, and the U.K., how much does the U.S. spend on health care as a share of its GDP?

Q04019_en.title: U.S. Relative Health Outcomes
Q04019_en.description: Relative to other rich countries like France, Germany, and the U.K., how good are health outcomes, such as life expectancy or infant mortality, in the U.S.?

Expected effects.title: Expected effects
Expected effects.description: Questions to examine the expected effects of health policy

Q06001.title: Reason for Individual Mandate
Q06001.description: In your view, what is the main reason for having an individual mandate?

Q06002.title: Individual Mandate Evaluation
Q06002.description: Would you say that an individual mandate is beneficial or detrimental?

Q06003_en.title: Changing Job because of Health Insurance
Q06003_en.description: Fear of changing jobs due to fear of losing employer-sponsored health insurance?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: If people have health insurance through their employer, do you think this would discourage them from quitting a bad job or switching job from fear of losing their health insurance?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: If you have or had health insurance through your employer, do you think this would discourage you from quitting a bad job and switching job for fear of losing your health insurance?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: If women have health insurance through their employer, do you think this would discourage them from quitting a bad job or switching job from fear of losing their health insurance?

Q06004_1_en.title: Health Insurance Incentives
Q06004_1_en.description: Behavioral effects of more generous health insurance

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Make less use of the emergency room for conditions that do not warrant it

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Make less use of the emergency room for conditions that do not warrant it

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Make less use of the emergency room for conditions that do not warrant it

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Use more medical services they do not really need simply because they do not have to pay the full cost of them

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Use more medical services they do not really need simply because they do not have to pay the full cost of them

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Use more medical services they do not really need simply because they do not have to pay the full cost of them

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Use more preventive medical care such as regular screenings and check-ups

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Use more preventive medical care such as regular screenings and check-ups

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Use more preventive medical care such as regular screenings and check-ups

Q06006_en.title: Quality of Healthcare
Q06006_en.description: Effect of less generous health insurance on health coverage and outcomes

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: With less generous health insurance, health in the U.S. would be worse since many people could not afford sufficient and appropriate medical care.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: With less generous health insurance, my health would be worse since I could not afford sufficient and appropriate medical care.

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: With less generous health insurance for women's health issues, health in the U.S. would be worse since many women could not afford sufficient and appropriate medical care.

Q06007_en.title: Total Costs of Healthcare
Q06007_en.description: Effect of more generous health insurance on healthcare costs

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: More generous health insurance coverage for preventive care can lead to a reduction in total medical costs, since medical issues would be caught early on before they  turn into more serious and expensive health conditions and because many medical problems could be avoided altogether.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: More generous health insurance coverage for preventive care can lead to a reduction of my total medical costs, since it would allow me to catch medical issues early on before they turn into more serious and expensive health conditions and because many medical problems could be avoided altogether.

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: More generous health insurance coverage for preventive care for women can lead to a reduction in total medical costs, since women's medical issues would be caught early on before they turn into more serious and expensive health conditions and because many medical problems could be avoided altogether.

Q06008_en.title: Health-related Financial Stress
Q06008_en.description: Effect of more generous health insurance on financial stress

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: More generous health insurance can help people deal with unexpected large medical costs. It can thus reduce financial stress and debt built up to pay the medical bills for families.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: More generous health insurance could help me deal with unexpected large medical costs. It can thus reduce my financial stress and I won't have to build up debt to pay the medical bills for my family.

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: More generous health insurance can help women deal with unexpected large medical costs. It can thus reduce women's financial stress and debt built up to pay the medical bills for women's health issues.

Q06009_en.title: Higher Costs of Pre-existing Conditions
Q06009_en.description: Fairness of people with pre-existing conditions having to pay more for their health insurance than people without pre-existing conditions?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair that people with pre-existing conditions have to pay more for their health insurance than people without pre-existing conditions?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair if you had to pay more for your health insurance than people with fewer pre-existing conditions than you?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Would you say that it is fair or unfair that women with pre-existing conditions have to pay more for their health insurance than women without pre-existing conditions?

Q06010_en.title: Higher Costs of Worse Health at Birth
Q06010_en.description: Fairness of people born with worse health having to pay more for health care or insurance than people born with better health?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Is it fair or unfair that people born with worse health have to pay more for health care or insurance than people born with better health?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Is it fair or unfair if you had to pay more for health care or insurance than people born with better health than you?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Is it fair or unfair that women born with worse health have to pay more for health care or insurance than women born with better health?

Q06011_en.title: Responsibility for Health Issues
Q06011_en.description: What is more responsible for the health issues across the U.S. today?
sorter: Mostly the result of circumstances outside of one’s control
Mostly the result of one’s own actions

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Would you say that health issues and medical conditions are mostly the result of circumstances outside of one's control or mostly the result of one's own actions?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Would you say that your own health issues and your own medical conditions are mostly the result of circumstances outside of your control or mostly the result of your own actions?

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: Would you say that health issues and medical conditions that arise for women are mostly the result of circumstances outside of their control or mostly the result of these women's own actions?

Q06013_en.title: Healthcare to Reduce Contagion
Q06013_en.description: Importance of everyone affording healthcare to reduce the chances of contagion spreading.

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: It is important that everyone can afford health care because people who become sick with a contagious disease that is not treated can have negative effects on others too.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: It is important that I am able to afford health care because if I became sick with a contagious disease that is not treated, I can have negative effects on others too.

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: It is important that all women can afford proper health care because women who become sick with a contagious disease that is not treated can have negative effects on others too.

Q06014_en.title: Low-income Families' Medical Care
Q06014_en.description: Importance of helping low-income families afford medical care

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: It is important to help low-income families so that they can afford medical care by subsidizing their insurance premiums or by giving them transfers for medical care.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: It is important to help families like mine so that they can afford medical care by subsidizing our insurance premiums or by giving us transfers for medical care.

questions.title: GENDER
questions.description: It is important to help low-income women so that they can afford medical care by subsidizing their insurance premiums or by giving them transfers for medical care.

Q06015_en.title: Employers with Religious Objections
Q06015_en.description: If you had to choose, which comes closest to your view? Employers who have religious objections to the use of birth control should be...
sorter: ... able to refuse to provide it in health insurance plans for their employees.
... required to provide it in health insurance plans for their employees just as other employers are required to do.

Q06016_en.title: Cost of Birth Control
Q06016_en.description: Would you find it fair or unfair that women who use birth control methods pay for the cost of birth control on their own?

Q06017_en.title: Copays for Birth Control
Q06017_en.description: Should women who are planning on using birth control methods have increased insurance copays because they might cost more for their insurers?

Q06018_en.title: Pharmacists Opting Out in Abortion Cases
Q06018_en.description: Do you favor or oppose a law allowing pharmacists and health providers to opt out of providing medicine or surgical procedures that result in abortion?

Q06019_en.title: Insurance for Abortion
Q06019_en.description: Should insurance providers have to cover medicine or surgical procedures that result in abortion?

Results.title: Results
Results.description: Questions to examine the results health policy

Q07001_en.title: Access to healthcare
Q07001_en.description: Is access to health care in the U.S. today fair for everyone?
sorter: Access to health care is fair even for low-income families
Access to health care should be improved for many families

Q07004_en.title: Fairness of U.S. Health Insurance System
Q07004_en.description: How fair is the current U.S. health insurance system?

Q07005_en.title: Satisfaction with US health insurance system
Q07005_en.description: How satisfied or dissatisfied are you with health insurance in the U.S.?

Q07006_en.title: Support for Medicare-for-all
Q07006_en.description: As you may know, some have proposed a 'Medicare-for-all' single payer health insurance program that would be administered by the federal government advanced through taxes. Please tell us if you favor or oppose this proposal, or if you don't know enough to say?

Q07007_en.title: Additional Help for Low-income Families
Q07007_en.description: Do you support additional transfers or subsidies to low-income families to help with the costs of health care?

Q07008_en.title: Support for Individual Mandate
Q07008_en.description: Do you support an individual mandate whereby every individual is obliged to buy health insurance?

Q07009_en.title: Support for Employer Mandate
Q07009_en.description: Do you support or oppose having an employer mandate whereby every large employer, with more than 50 employees, is obliged to offer health insurance plans for their employees?

Q07010_1_en.title: Desired Design of Health Insurance
Q07010_1_en.description: Desired Design of Health Insurance for the following types of of medical care: Preventive care, Primary care visits, Maternity and newborn care, Specialist visits for non-essential care, Medical care for catastrophic situations, Emergency room care, Pediatric care

questions.title: Preventive Care
questions.description: Preventive care (e.g.: annual physical examinations, recommended cancer screening, or immunizations)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Primary Care Visits
questions.description: Primary care visits for non-life threatening conditions (e.g.: for a cold, flu, or stomach bug)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Maternity and Newborn Care
questions.description: Maternity and newborn care (pre-natal screenings and check-ups, birth and delivery, newborn screening and care)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Specialist Visits for Non-essential Care
questions.description: Specialist visits for non-essential care (e.g.: elective hip replacement, hearing aids)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Medical Care for Catastrophic Situations
questions.description: Medical care for catastrophic situations (e.g.: long-run medical care after bad accidents or serious injuries once one leaves the emergency room, intensive treatment for cancers, management of serious, long-term hear and liver conditions)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Emergency Room Care
questions.description: Emergency room care (emergency, short-term care after accidents, severe illness, life-threatening conditions that require immediate attention)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

questions.title: Pediatric Care
questions.description: Pediatric care (medical care for children)
sorter: full coverage (the patient pays no costs out of pocket)
generous coverage (the patient has only minimal copay or deductibles)
low coverage (costs are shared and the patient bears a significant share of total costs)
no coverage (meaning the patient has to pay the full costs out of pocket)

Government questions (specific).title: Government questions (specific)
Government questions (specific).description: Questions to examine government intervention regarding health policy

Q09001_en.title: Improve Healthcare
Q09001_en.description: To improve access to health care for all Americans, rich or poor, the government (local, state, or federal) has the ability and the tools to do:

Text Anaysis.title: Text Anaysis
Text Anaysis.description: Questions to examine textual analysis regarding trade policy

Q02002.title: Main considerations
Q02002.description: When you think about trade policy and whether the U.S. should put some restrictions on trade with other countries such as tariffs, what are the main considerations that come to your mind?

Q02003.title: Goals
Q02003.description: What would be a ”good” trade policy in your view? What would be the goal of a good trade policy?

Q02004.title: Shortcomings
Q02004.description: What do you think are the issues with or shortcomings of the current U.S. trade policy?

Personal Exposure.title: Personal Exposure
Personal Exposure.description: Questions to examine the individual's exposure to trade policy

Q03001_en.title: Personal Impact of Trade Policy
Q03001_en.description: Do you feel that U.S. trade policy has important, direct effects on your own life?
sorter: Yes, it has very important direct effects on my own life; It has some effects on my own life
No, it has no direct effects on my own life

Knowledge about policy.title: Knowledge about policy
Knowledge about policy.description: Questions to examine the individual's knowledge about trade policy

Q04002_en.title: Import Tariff
Q04002_en.description: Do you know what an import tariff is?
Q04002_en.correct: A tariff on goods coming into a country from abroad, often used by governments as a way of reducing imports and protecting local industries.

Q04004_en.title: Import Quota
Q04004_en.description: Do you know what an import quota is?
Q04004_en.correct: The import quota means physical limitation of the quantities of different products to be imported from foreign countries within a specified period of time, usually one year. The import quota may be fixed either in terms of quantity or the value of the product.

Q04006_en.title: Share of Agricultural Imports
Q04006_en.description: What share of the goods that the U.S. imports are agricultural goods?

Q04007_en.title: Share of Imports Subject to Tariff
Q04007_en.description: Of all the goods that the U.S. imports, what share is subject to a tariff or import duty?

Q04009_en.title: Principal Export Destination
Q04009_en.description: To which country does the U.S. export the most, in terms of the net dollar value?

Q04010_en.title: Principal Import Provenance
Q04010_en.description: From which country does the U.S. import the most, in terms of the net dollar value

Q04011_en.title: Trade Evolution Over Time
Q04011_en.description: Over time, how has the level of trade between the U.S. and other countries changed?
sorter: It has stayed more or less the same

Expected Effects.title: Expected Effects
Expected Effects.description: Questions to examine the expected effects of trade policy

Q06001_1_en.title: Effects of Trade
Q06001_1_en.description: As trade with other countries has increased, how much have the following groups lost or gained from it? Please rate on a scale of 1 to 5, 1 being 'lost a lot' and 5 'gained a lot'.

Q06201B.title: Personal situation
Q06201B.description: On balance, would you say that trade between the U.S. and other countries has made you better off or worse off?

Q06201C_1.title: Magnitude on personal situation
Q06201C_1.description: How much do you think you have lost or won as trade with other countries has increased, on a scale of 1 to 5 (1 being 'lost a lot' and 5 'gained a lot').

Q06003_en.title: Effect on Jobs
Q06003_en.description: Whether increased trade with other countries affects American jobs, on a scale of 1 to 5 (1 being 'lost a lot' and 5 'gained a lot').

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Do you feel that most American jobs are being affected by US trade policy?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Do you feel that your own job is being affected by U.S. trade policy?

Q06004_en.title: Effect on Workers
Q06004_en.description: Overall, has international trade helped or hurt U.S. workers?

Q06105.title: Ability to find a new job
Q06105.description: Do you think it is easy for the following types of workers to find jobs in a different sectors from the ones they are currently working in?

questions.title: Low-skilled workers
questions.description: Whether it is easy for low-skilled workers to find a job in a different sector from the one they are currently working in?

questions.title: High-skilled workers
questions.description: Whether it is easy for high-skilled workers to find a job in a different sector from the one they are currently working in?

questions.title: Specific (you)
questions.description: Would it be easy for you to find a job in a different sector from the one you are currently working in?

Q06007_1_en.title: Unemployment and Inequality
Q06007_1_en.description: To what extent do you think that trade with other countries is a major reason for unemployment and a rise in inequality in the U.S.?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Unemployment in some sectors and the decline of some industries in the U.S.

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Unemployment in your sector and the decline of some industries in the U.S.

Q06009_en.title: Price of Goods
Q06009_en.description: Overall, has international trade decreased the prices of goods sold in the U.S.?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Overall, has international trade decreased the prices of goods sold in the U.S.?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Overall, has international trade decreased the prices of goods that you buy regularly?

Q06010_en.title: Innovation
Q06010_en.description: Do you think that the competitive pressure from international trade has increased innovation in the U.S.?

Q06011_en.title: GDP
Q06011_en.description: Overall, do you think that international trade has increased the growth of the GDP in the U.S.?

Q06012_en.title: Dollar value
Q06012_en.description: If the U.S. exports more goods abroad, what do you think will happen to the value of the dollar?

Q06013_en.title: Benefits of Trade
Q06013_en.description: Does trade make the countries involved better off in general?
sorter: In general, both countries are better off
In general, one country gains, the other one loses

Q06014_en.title: Importing Lower-priced Goods
Q06014_en.description: Imagine the U.S. is able to produce better cars at a lower price than Germany is. Would it still make sense under some circumstances for the U.S. to import cars from Germany?

Example.title: Example
Example.description: The U.S. is a large net exporter of laptops (meaning that it sells more laptops abroad than it purchases from abroad and that U.S. laptops are a large share of all laptops sold in the world), and a large net importer of cars (meaning that it purchases more cars from abroad than it sells abroad and that cars purchased by customers in the U.S. are a large share of worldwide car purchases). The laptop sector employs many high-skilled, college-educated workers. The car sector em- ploys many low-skilled workers. Cars are produced for cheaper abroad, while laptops are produced for cheaper in the U.S.

Q06015_en.title: Long example
Q06015_en.description: Imagine now that the U.S. starts importing even more cars and producing less cars domestically.

questions.title: Price of Cars
questions.description: What will happen to the price of cars in the U.S.?

questions.title: Car Consumers
questions.description: Would you say that households who purchase cars in the U.S. are now better off?

questions.title: Low-skilled Workers' Wages
questions.description: What will happen to the wages of low-skilled workers working in the car sector?

questions.title: Price of U.S. Laptops Abroad
questions.description: Imagine also that the U.S. starts producing and exporting more laptops. What will happen to the price of U.S. laptops abroad, i.e., in the countries where the U.S. sells laptops?

questions.title: High-skilled Workers' Wages
questions.description: What will happen to the wages of high-skilled workers working in the laptop sector?

questions.title: Changing Sectors and Increase in Exports
questions.description: Imagine that over time, some low-skilled workers from the car sector are able to quit their jobs and find new jobs in the laptop sector. What will happen to their wages now if the U.S. exports more laptops?

questions.title: Export Tax on Laptops
questions.description: If the U.S. were to impose an export tax on laptops, what would happen to the price of laptops abroad?

questions.title: Import Tariff on Cars
questions.description: If the U.S. were to impose an import tariff on cars sold in the U.S, what would happen to the price of cars in the U.S?

questions.title: Export Increase on Wages
questions.description: If exports from your sector to other countries would increase, what do you think will happen to your wage?

questions.title: Import Increase on Wages
questions.description: If the U.S. imported more of the goods produced in your sector, what do you think would happen to your wage?

Results.title: Results
Results.description: Questions to examine the results of trade policy

Q07001_en.title: Support for less trade barriers
Q07001_en.description: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: 'Increasing trade with other countries and reducing barriers to trade is something the U.S. should aim for.'

Q07002_en.title: Fairness current trade policy
Q07002_en.description: Fairness of the current U.S. trade policy?

Q07003_en.title: Satisfaction with current trade policy
Q07003_en.description: Satisfaction with the current U.S. trade policy?

Q07006_1_en.title: Effects on Unemployment
Q07006_1_en.description: What do you think is the best policy tool to help workers in a declining industry threatened by foreign competition? Please rank the following options from best (1) to worst (3).

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: How effectively would restricting imports help workers in such an industry?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: How effectively would restricting imports help workers in your industry?

questions.title: Provide more generous transfers and direct assistance
CONTROL
questions.description: How effectively would providing generous transfers and direct assistance help workers in such an industry?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: How effectively would providing generous transfers and direct assistance help workers in your industry?

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: How effectively would subsidizing production help workers in such an industry?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: How effectively would subsidizing production help workers in your industry?

Q07007_en.title: National Food Security
Q07007_en.description: What do you think is the best policy tool to ensure national food security?
sorter: Provide more production subsidies in the food sector

Q07008_en.title: Tariff Responses
Q07008_en.description: If the U.S. imposes tariffs on many imports, how likely or unlikely is it that other countries follow suit and also impose tariffs?

Q07009_en.title: Protect New Industries
Q07009_en.description: Let us consider a given relatively new industry in which other countries are currently able to produce goods for cheaper than American firms. Do you think it makes sense to protect American firms in this industry by using tariffs or import restrictions (even if this means higher prices for consumers) or is it better to let the American firms immediately face foreign competition, forcing them to become more competitive?
sorter: It makes sense to protect for a while
It makes sense to let these firms face foreign competition to become more competitive

questions.title: CONTROL
questions.description: Let us consider a given relatively new industry in which other countries are currently able to produce goods for cheaper than American firms. In your opinion, does it make sense to protect the American firms in this industry by using tariffs or import restrictions (even if this means higher prices for consumers) or is it better to let the American firms immediately face foreign competition, forcing them to become more competitive?

questions.title: YOU
questions.description: Imagine that the goods or services currently produced in your sector or industry can actually be produced in a cheaper way in another country. In your opinion, would it make sense to protect the American firms in your sector or industry by using tariffs or import restrictions (even If this means higher prices for consumers) or would it be better to let the American firms in your sector or industry immediately face foreign competition, forcing them to become more competitive?

Views on government.title: Views on government
Views on government.description: Questions to examine views on government

Q09003_en.title: Gains and Losses of Increase in Trade
Q09003_en.description: Which statement comes closest to your views? When there is more trade between the US and other countries…
sorter: ... most people gain, but a few people lose a lot.'
... most people lose, but a few gain a lot.'

General views on government.title: General views on government
General views on government.description: Questions on the individual's views on the government

G10001_en.title: Trust
G10001_en.description: How much of the time do you think you can trust our federal government to do what is right?

G10002_en.title: Current intervention level
G10002_en.description: Some people think the government is trying to do too many things that should be left to individuals and businesses. Others think that government should do more to solve our country's problems. Which come closer to your own view?
sorter: Government is doing just the right amount

G10003_en.title: Theoretical intervention level
G10003_en.description: Where would you rate yourself on a scale of 1 to 5, where 1 means you think the government should do only those things necessary to provide the most basic government functions, and 5 means you think the government should take active steps in every area it can to try and improve the lives of its citizens?

G10005_en.title: Satisfaction
G10005_en.description: Are you very satisfied, somewhat satisfied, somewhat dissatisfied, or very dissatisfied with the way the federal government in Washington is dealing with the problems the country is facing today?

Views on government responsibility.title: Views on government responsibility
Views on government responsibility.description: On a 1 to 5 scale, please say how much responsibility the respondent think the government should have for various functions, where 1 is no responsibility, 5 is total responsibility

G10006_1_en.title: Reduce income differences
G10006_1_en.description: Reducing income differences between the rich and the poor

G10006_2_en.title: Reduce wealth transmission
G10006_2_en.description: Reducing the transmission of wealth from one generation to the other

G10006_3_en.title: Ensuring health care
G10006_3_en.description: Making sure Americans have adequate health care

G10006_4_en.title: Reducing opportunity differences
G10006_4_en.description: Reducing the differences in opportunities between children from wealthy and poor families

G10006_5_en.title: Regulating trade
G10006_5_en.description: Regulating trade to and from the U.S. to protect American producers and consumers

G10006_6_en.title: Stabilizing financial system
G10006_6_en.description: Maintaining a stable financial system and enrusing that credit markets work

G10006_8_en.title: Providing minimum living
G10006_8_en.description: Providing a minimum standard of living for all
